etymology.description: Depicts grass blades -> duplication of 屮(屮) (chè, "grass") -> related to the top component of 萅(萅) (chūn, "spring")
etymology.interpretation: The character 艸(艸) (cǎo, "grass") visually represents two grass blades side by side, emphasizing its natural form and connection to vegetation.

examples.chinese: 春风吹拂时(春風吹拂時)，艸生长得茂盛(艸生長得茂盛)。
examples.pinyin: Chūn fēng chuīfú shí, cǎo shēngzhǎng dé màoshèng.
examples.english: When the spring breeze blows, the grass grows lushly.

examples.chinese: 野外一片艸(野外一片艸)，生机盎然(生機盎然)。
examples.pinyin: Yěwài yī piàn cǎo, shēngjī àngrán.
examples.english: In the wilderness, the grass thrives with vitality.

examples.chinese: 大地披上了艸(大地披上了艸)。
examples.english: The earth is draped in grass.
